Starting a business can be both exciting AND intimidating. There are just so many things to consider in climbing the stairway to success, but if you take it one step at a time, it could be easier than you think.
Here are 4 steps to get you started as well as some inspiring words from female South African entrepreneurs:
Choose your direction
You’ve decided you want to be your own boss, but do you have a clear idea of what product or service you’d like to sell? If not, think about all the things that you’re good at and think of fun ways you could make money from them. Sooner or later you’ll have a winning idea that you LOVE.
WORDS FROM THE WISE
Whatever business idea you decide on, make sure it’s something that other people can connect with on a personal level. Although it’s not her own quote, South African business consultant Anja van Beek likes to share this famous line with her clients:
Choose your direction
You’ve decided you want to be your own boss, but do you have a clear idea of what product or service you’d like to sell? If not, think about all the things that you’re good at and think of fun ways you could make money from them. Sooner or later you’ll have a winning idea that you LOVE.
WORDS FROM THE WISE
Whatever business idea you decide on, make sure it’s something that other people can connect with on a personal level. Although it’s not her own quote, South African business consultant Anja van Beek likes to share this famous line with her clients:
Get supplies sorted
Now, think of the type of supplies you’ll need to start doing business. HomeChoice has some great products and bundles to get hairstyling, food preparation and fitness businesses started (click on the links here to browse). If you don’t have a lot of money to start off with, buying your supplies on HomeChoice’s low monthly payment terms will definitely help get the ball rolling.
WORDS FROM THE WISE
You’ll want to start small, testing to see how many people are interested in your product/ service before going all out. The most important thing is to start somewhere.

You’ll want to start small, testing to see how many people are interested in your product/ service before going all out. The most important thing is to start somewhere.
Spread the news
Posting on social media is arguably one of the best ways to advertise almost anything – FOR FREE. It can be very effective IF you maintain good contact with your potential customers. You’ll need to respond quickly to messages and phone calls in order to keep their interest captured.
This means having a home office connected to the internet and a reliable cellphone to manage calls on the go. Luckily, HomeChoice has fantastic home office equipment like laptops, office furniture and smartphone deals to make this easy for you.
WORDS FROM THE WISE
There’s quite a bit of admin involved in starting your own business, and it’s important to get this smoothed out early on so that you don’t find yourself in legal trouble down the line. Here’s a very helpful article from Briefly to lead you through the finer details as well as some encouragement from another successful business owner:
Spread the news

Secure your future
Now that you have an idea of your business’s potential, you can think about slowly expanding from the basics with the help of a small loan from FinChoice. When you’re looking forward, don’t forget to protect the investments you’ve already made in your business. You may want to invest in security systems and storage solutions to help prevent damage or theft.
WORDS FROM THE WISE
In the business world, as in life, there will always be ups and downs. Never let the difficult moments get in the way of living your dream. I end with a quote from Melanie Hawken, the founder and CEO of Public Benefit Corporation Lionesses of Africa, a community dedicated to encouraging female entrepreneurs from Africa:

LYN HOLM
HomeChoice Copywriter
When she’s not writing for HomeChoice, Lyn enjoys selling colourful hair dye to her friends and family. She hopes to turn this hobby into a small business in the future.
